column5: I know there are Customer & Duty-Free allowances for Canadian Residence (listed below)  Residents returning to Canada: After 24 hr absence...C$50 --No Tobacco and Liquor After 48 hr absence...C$400 Tobacco...200 Cigarettes and 50 Cigars and 200g of loose Tobacco. Liquor....1.14L of spirits, 1.5L of wine,or 24 bottles or cans of beer.(8.5L) After 7 days absence...C$750 Tobacco...200 Cigarettes and 50 Cigars and 200g of Tobacco Liquor....1.14 litres of liquor or 1.5 litres of wine.  What about for visitors to Canada?  In-laws (non-canadian) came over couple weeks ago and plan to go shopping in the states. However, I have not been able to find any information regarding customs & duty-free allowances for them  Thanks for the help!
The restrictions you list are for Residents returning to Canada. You will need to look up Non-Residents entering Canada, but since they are visiting, why not shop Canadian.
thanks for the help, but that website does not have the information I need
Visitors in Canada are treated as Canadian Residence. Do not have to be a Canadian.
